messages:
Slide 1: Introduction to Equivalent Fractions
Content:
• Students will be able to identify and create equivalent fractions using visual models and multiplication
• Key vocabulary: equivalent fractions, numerator, denominator

Teacher Notes:
• Begin with a think-pair-share about what students already know about fractions
• Use pizza or chocolate bar examples to make it relatable

Visual Elements:
• Pizza diagram showing 1/2 and 2/4 as equivalent

Slide 2: Understanding Equivalent Fractions
Content:
• Equivalent fractions are different fractions that show the same amount
• Think of it like sharing a pizza: cutting it into 2 pieces or 4 pieces still gives you the same amount when you take half
• Let's explore how 1/2 = 2/4 = 4/8

Teacher Notes:
• Use manipulatives or virtual fraction strips
• Have students fold paper strips to demonstrate

Visual Elements:
• Fraction strips showing multiple equivalents
• Interactive number line

Slide 3: Finding Equivalent Fractions
Content:
• To find equivalent fractions, multiply or divide both the numerator and denominator by the same number
• Example: 1/2 × 2/2 = 2/4
• Remember: multiplying by 1 (2/2, 3/3, etc.) doesn't change the value

Teacher Notes:
• Use think-alouds to model the process
• Provide multiple examples with visual support

Visual Elements:
• Step-by-step multiplication examples
• Visual models showing the process

Slide 4: Practice Together
Content:
• Let's practice finding equivalent fractions together
• Group activity: Create fraction cards and find matches
• Quick check: Is 2/3 equivalent to 4/6? How do you know?

Teacher Notes:
• Form small groups for collaborative practice
• Circulate to provide support and check understanding

Visual Elements:
• Sample fraction cards
• Work space for calculations

Slide 5: Show What You Know
Content:
• Independent practice time
• Complete the equivalent fraction matching game
• Exit ticket: Create three equivalent fractions for 3/4

Teacher Notes:
• Provide fraction circles or strips as needed
• Use exit ticket responses to plan follow-up instruction

Visual Elements:
• Example of completed exit ticket
• Success criteria checklist
